Author: jansako#3330
Content:
Hi Miners, can anyone explain this apparent Nicehash nonsense? 
https://imgur.com/a/NMWtg3G

I have 2 orders, the 'standard' one has twice the hash and half the cash remaining compared to the 'fixed' one, yet both show the same estimated time. What gives?

Author: jansako#3330
Content: summoning @ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉, the guru of NH  游땎

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: their algo is to maximize their revenues, what else matters?

Author: jansako#3330
Content: well they won't me maximizing much from me any more... first and last 'fixed' order that I placed if that is the case...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dont be so harsh, they need to have their "bugs" to maximize their profits

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @jansako don't ever try to make sense of what NH does

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: @jansako "remaining time" is the value of current hash cost / btc remaining

Author: jansako#3330
Content: right, so I would expect the fixed order, with a larger cost remaining and less hash being used to have a longer time remaining

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the sooner it runs out the sooner you have to put more in

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what is the nicehash percentage?

Author: jansako#3330
Content: 5% when placing the order

Author: jansako#3330
Content: + random fees for payouts, deposits & such

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no wonder they do what they do

Author: jansako#3330
Content: yep, a 0.01 BTC order starts off as 0.095

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
`Non-refundable new order fee     0.0001 BTC
Amount spent on orders for buying hashing power
(unspent amount on canceled orders is not subjected to this fee)
    3%`

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: not exactly "random"

Author: jansako#3330
Content: Fees they charge you for various operations (deposit, withdraw, 'payout' if you are selling hash) seem random to me. I am sure they are all listed somewhere on page 683 of the T&C.  Yes, I admit it is my fault for not reading up on them beforehand.

Author: jansako#3330
Content: Not exactly complaining, but it is one of the reasons I stopped selling hash through them as a backup for MRR.
